meanings.definition: To link or connect together in a line or chain.
meanings.sent1: The children coffled together to form a human chain.
meanings.sent2: The workers coffled the boxes in a straight line for easy transport.
meanings.sent3: The students coffled in a line for the school field trip.
meanings.sent4: The beads on the necklace were coffled together beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The cars were coffled bumper to bumper in the traffic jam.

meanings.definition: To lead or guide a group of people or animals by linking them together.
meanings.sent1: The shepherd coffled the sheep to the pasture.
meanings.sent2: The tour guide coffled the tourists through the museum.
meanings.sent3: The teacher coffled the students on the nature walk.
meanings.sent4: The mother coffled her children safely through the crowded market.
meanings.sent5: The lifeguard coffled the swimmers to safety during the rescue.

meanings.definition: To organize or manage a group of people or things in a coordinated manner.
meanings.sent1: The event planner coffled the vendors for the festival.
meanings.sent2: The project manager coffled the team to work on the assignment.
meanings.sent3: The coach coffled the players for the championship game.
meanings.sent4: The conductor coffled the musicians for the orchestra performance.
meanings.sent5: The teacher coffled the students for the group project presentation.
